©Brooklyn Museum of Art, New York, USAGift of Marcia and John Friede/Bridgeman Images

The Lukasa shown can be attributed to the Luba culture because of its use as a

choices.label: gift for young men who are coming of age
mnemonic device in retelling oral legends
pendant to display one’s ancestral lineage
record of one’s achievements in warfare

topic.text: 6.2: Purpose and Audience in African Art

skill.text: Skill 6.B: Justify an attribution of a work of art by explaining similarities with work by a specific artist, culture, art historical style, or object type from the image set.
